Transcript:
M: Ms. Simpson, can you tell me why you applied to work at our store? Judging from your resume, it appears you have no retail experience. What do you think makes you qualified for selling apparel?
W: You’re right. I previously worked as a secretary at a hospital. At that time, I learned that I really enjoy working with people. So I thought working in retail would be a good fit for me.
M: Yes, that is very important. Here at our store, we expect all employees to be kind and helpful with each and every customer. Next, I’d like to ask about your availability during the week.

W-Am: Jerry, Q1 you know how we paint each apartment before new tenants move in? It’s getting to be a problem because our maintenance workers can’t always get to it right away.
M-Au: We should hire a professional painting company to come in to do that work.
W-Am: Q2 We considered that before, but we thought it would be too expensive.
M-Au: Yes, but that was quite a while ago. Q2 We manage more apartments now.
W-Am: That's true. Even without painting, our staff is already busy dealing with an increase in maintenance requests.
M-Au: Right. Q3 And that’s why it would be better to contract the work out. I’ll call some painting companies right now for some price estimates.

M: Q2 Yes, I’ve just been asked to attend a meeting with an important client later today, and that means I can’t make it to see Dr. Lee at four. Q3 Is there any way you could fit me in earlier today?
W: Hmm... No, I’m sorry. We’re completely booked for today. Another patient has canceled an appointment for eight o’clock tomorrow morning, though. Can you come in then?
M: Sure, that’s no problem. I’ll be there by eight. Thanks so much for your help.

M: I don’t really feel comfortable agreeing on a price now. Q3 Why don’t you give me a call in two weeks? I should have a better idea how much to charge for the crop then.

W-Am: Monday's fine. Q2 The store's scheduled to open the following Saturday, so that should give me plenty of time to set up. Q3 I'm just worried about things breaking during the move. It's all handmade pottery, so it's quite delicate.

M1: Hi Bob, hi Karen. The reason I called you in is to talk about the budget for the last two months. This biggest issue is that our entertainment expenses are way too high. I think we need to reduce the amount we are spending on company lunches and dinners.
W: Yes, I agree. I think we need to start paying for our own lunches.
M2: I agree with both of you, but I think we need to keep entertaining clients. I think if we pay for our own lunches, then that will leave money to take clients out for dinner.
M1: That’s a pretty good idea Bob. Karen, does that sound OK with you?
W: I think that’s a great compromise Bob. I will make a monthly budget plan and e-mail it to you this afternoon.

answer.explanation: Hi everybody, this is the late shift with Joey Denton on Free Net Radio. Today we have George Farrelli in the studio to talk about his hit new album, which has been number one on the charts for six weeks . Earlier today, George was telling me how his album was heavily influenced by his recent move to London, and the growing rock and roll scene there. You can definitely hear the British influence in the title track “Frankly Speaking”. Coming up next, we will discuss George’s up and coming marriage to his longtime girlfriend Cindy Pullman. Thanks for joining us today George.

There's one thing though — while Q2 everyone at Yamaguchi loved the design, they did suggest that we expand our color selection. So, Q3 before we start production, we're going to conduct a survey in several Japanese cities to see which colors people like best.

question.text: What did Yamaguchi Distributors like about the bicycles?
What is the company going to do before starting production?
When picking up identification badges, employees need to show  _____  of employment at Ekmekci Associates.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: A ___ number of technical service requests from users prompted Hisocom Corporation to upgrade its Internet servers.

answer.explanation: Significant = Great

question.text: We read about Mr. Moriwaki’s promotion___the company newsletter.

answer.explanation: (A)”In” is used for publications. Choices (B), (C), and (D)  cannot be used in this context.

question.text: _____ buildings in a neighborhood can lead to a net loss of property values for nearby homeowners.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose C

question.text: Fewer than ten accounting firms in the country have received the Barstow Award ___ excellence in customer service.

answer.explanation: Award for st

question.text: The hotel's quiet mountain setting provides a ___ change for visitors who live in a crowded city,

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the noun "change" so we choose an adjective.

question.text: Please refer to the attached flowchart, which describes the  _____  of responsibilities among the various leadership positions.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>C

question.text: The annual report indicates significant growth ___ the past several years.

answer.explanation: Over + Time period

question.text: See our media kit for facts and information   _____ our line of lighting equipment.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: Rockwell Bank’s automated teller machines are  _____  located in various sections of the city.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> B

question.text: The Moore Landmark Society has asked that city council members ___ the demolition of

answer.explanation: Ask that sb do st

question.text: I___eat at expensive restaurants because I don’t have a lot of extra money.

answer.explanation: (D) “Seldom” means “almost never”. Choices (A), (B), and (C) are all opposite in meaning.

question.text: Insofar as the company is liable for ___, the dissatisfied customer will be compensated for any damage.

answer.explanation:
Insofar as = To the degree that
Liable for = Responsible for
Negligence = Paying no attention

question.text: Tomorrow we will meet with a ___ of consultants who specialize in staff training and team building.

answer.explanation: "Supply", "measure", and "fraction" are not used for humans so we choose "group".

question.text: The bookcase is___the door.

answer.explanation: (A) “Beside” means “next to”. Choices (B) and (C) require more than one reference point. Choice (D) should be “across from”.

question.text: The evaluation report will be completed  ______ after the auditors inspect the laboratory.

answer.explanation: Only after + a clause

question.text: After all resumes have been reviewed, selected candidates will be ___ for interviews.

answer.explanation:
Invite sb for st
Signal to sb for st

question.text: When he served as president of Delvan Manufacturing, Pierre Dunn ___ several policies that transformed the company.

answer.explanation: Institute = Introduce

question.text: The accountants were unable to produce a full report by the deadline but promised that _____ would give a summary of the important points.

answer.explanation:
The blank needs a subject for that clause
=> Choose C

question.text: The donations received from the fundraiser _____among the charity’s three locations equally.

answer.explanation:
Subject is "the donations" and use passive form
=> Choose D

question.text: A government_____   will visit the site to talk with protesters directly and seek a resolution.

answer.explanation: It is obvious that the subject of this sentence refer to people, so in the answers given, only A is correct.

question.text: Lawton Airways has announced that it will ___ increase its nonstop service from Cransen to Hopley City.

answer.explanation: Substantially = Greatly

question.text: The contract must be signed ------- the opening of formal discussions.

answer.explanation: Baased on the meaning of words.

question.text: The company’s new software for online banking is  _____  with most smartphone models.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>D

question.text: A reception will be held to introduce the newly _______ director of marketing to the employees of Kaulana Industries.
Mr. Wagner will arrange the schedule of events for the ………………..of the flagship store.

answer.explanation:
Before the fill is "the", after the preposition is the preposition "of" à Need to fill in a noun => C and D are wrong.
based on the meaning, we choose A

question.text: The president of Paterson Industrial Soiutions has signed a number of important ___ this month.

answer.explanation: The answer comes after an adjective so we use a noun. There is "a number of" so we use the noun in its plural form.

question.text: The director of the Yeon Park Clinic will deliver a speech ------- tonight's benefit dinner.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=>Choose B

question.text: Dr. Johnson is offering a three-hour workshop during ___ she will share some perspectives on effective time management.

answer.explanation: This is a relative clause so we choose "which".

question.text: The grocery store chain Refresh Foods has  _____  in organic products since It opened in 2001.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>C

question.text:
Cecil Munrow, founder and president of Munrow's, Liverpool’s largest retail clothier, announced that he (1) _____ £4,000 to the city’s new community center. The funds derive from the sale of tickets to a party held last night at his company’s (2) _____ . Mr.Munrow will present a check to the center tomorrow at its opening ceremony.
(3) _____ the past twenty years, Mr. Munrow has organized several fund-raising events for charitable institutions and community services (4) _____ .
Cecil Munrow, founder and president of Munrow's, Liverpool’s largest retail clothier, announced that he (1) _____ £4,000 to the city’s new community center.

answer.explanation: "announced that ....." => use future tense

question.text:
To: pmendoza@factmail.co
From: recruiting@analystsassoc.org
Date: May 2
Subject: Joining ASA

Dear Mr. Mendoza,
Thank you for expressing your interest in our organization during the recent ----1--- . It was a pleasure meeting you at the ASA booth during the Weber Information Systems Convention. As you may recall from our conversation, we discussed how ASA membership ----2--- your career through networking opportunities as well as the industry insights offered in our monthly newsletter. The normal fee for members is just $120 a year; however, we are currently offering a new-member discount. ----3--- .
If you are still interested in joining , please reply to ----4--- with your mailing address . I will then forward you an application packet.
Sincerely,
Ashlee Loren, President
Association of Systems Analysts

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Select (A) by considering the context in which the hypothesis is being proposed (how the participant benefits), so the space must use the modal verb "can".

choices: (A) Discounts on rental cars are included in the annual membership.
(B) Our jobs board is quite comprehensive.
(C) We are the first organization of our kind.
(D) This month you can join for just half the usual rate.

answer.text: (D) This month you can join for just half the usual rate.
answer.explanation: Select (D) since the previous sentence has the word "discount", it is understandable that the sentence you need to fill will state how much discount is
Select (B) because the following sentence has the subject "I", so the space needs to be filled with an equivalent object (me).

Larry Martin
Kansas Neat & Tidy
5448 Lakeside Drive
Arlington, Kansas 67514

Dear Mr. Martin,

We are interested in using your company’s cleaning services for this year’s Halley Valley Rock Festival. question.text:
To: All Employees - staff@jointsystems.com
From: Fred Hanes - fhanes@jointsystems.com
Subject: Community Park Cleanup
Date: February 12

Joint Systems is a company that tries to take every opportunity to give back to our community. Therefore, I am urging all of our employees to take part in the upcoming community park cleanup sponsored by the city of Harrisburg. Without the dedication of volunteers, our parks and public spaces would not be free of litter. Donate some of your free time to keeping Harrisburg a beautiful and inviting city.
The community park cleanup will be held next Friday, February 18, from 1:00 to 5:00 P.M. Employees who wish to participate will leave work at lunchtime, yet will still be paid as if they had worked a full day. Volunteers are asked to bring supplies such as protective outerwear, tools, insect repellent, trash bags, and snacks.
A shuttle bus will depart from the company parking lot at 1:20 P.M. on Friday to take volunteers to the volunteer location. If you have a specific preference concerning the type of work you would like to do, please contact Event Organizer Don Lewis at 435- 555-6768.
We appreciate everyone’s enthusiasm and support.
Fred Hanes
Human Resources, Joint Systems
What would probably NOT be necessary for participants?

answer.explanation: By elimination method, we can see only the information in option A was not mentioned “Volunteers are asked to bring supplies such as protective outerwear, tools, insect repellent, trash bags, and snacks.”

question.text: According to the e-mail, what is Mr. Lewis responsible for?

answer.explanation: From the last sentence of paragraph 3 "If you have a specific preference concerning the type of work you would like to do, please contact Event Organizer Don Lewis at 435555-6768." You can see that the correct answer is C

question.text: What is the purpose of the e-mail?

answer.explanation: The content of this email is meant to introduce and encourage everyone to participate in a volunteer park cleanup session. So it best matches answer D.

question.text:
Nimblearn

Find the Information Your Company Needs

Nimblearn is a robust, next-generation tool designed to make creating surveys easy, effective, and affordable. Our intuitive Web-based software allows you to design and administer surveys and automatically track and analyze results.

You asked for it, we created it. We designed Nimblearn to include all the features you requested:

• A simple process for designing surveys that guides you every step of the way
• A huge list of question types, from true/false to open text, with advice on how and when to use each one
• A library of proven sample questions designed to gather essential feedback on quality
• Loads of quick and easy ways to distribute your surveys (e-mail, social)

Go to www.nimblearn.com to learn more.
How would a company most likely use Nimblearn?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "Nimblearn is a robust, next-generation tool designed to make creating surveys easy, effective, and affordable. Our intuitive Web-based software allows you to design and administer surveys and automatically track and analyze results."

question.text: What is suggested about the company that developed Nimblearn?
choices: (A) It was founded by a computer engineer.
(B) It posts customer reviews on its Web site.
(C) It has a reputation for producing high-quality goods.
(D) It used customer feedback in developing the product.

answer.text: (D) It used customer feedback in developing the product.
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred: "You asked for it, we created it. We designed Nimblearn to include all the features you requested."

question.text: What is NOT mentioned as a feature of Nimblearn?

answer.explanation:
(A) - A simple process for designing surveys that guides you every step of the way
(B) - A library of proven sample questions designed to gather essential feedback on quality
(D) - Loads of quick and easy ways to distribute your surveys (e-mail, social)

question.text:
Welcome Bags Available

The Fairmill Welcome Association (FWA) has decided on an exciting gift for new residents: a reusable shopping bag filled with information about the town of Fairmill. These cloth bags, which will have “Celebrate Fairmill” printed across the front, will be filled with community updates, coupons, and homebaked treats from association members. Local businesses interested in helping to fund this project can pay to have their logos printed on the back of the bags. Fairmill residents are encouraged to welcome their new neighbors by personally delivering these bags to each household. To sign up, please go online to visit our updated community Web site at fairmillwa.org

answer.explanation: Sign: "Fairmill residents are encouraged to welcome their new neighbors by personally delivering these bags to each household."

question.text:
MEMO
To: Customer Service Personnel
Subject: Meeting next Friday
Date: November 19
Last week we conducted a study to gather opinions about our customer service. The data are in and they look good. Most people expressed satisfaction with their communication with our representatives. Their questions about packaging services, shipping charges, and the status of their parcels were answered professionally and promptly.
One area that we need to address is the low number of referrals. Few customers we approached reported telling others about our services. Based on the answers, most people are repeat customers who always rely on us for their shipping needs, or they choose us based on our advertising. Clearly, we fail to request referrals properly.
Therefore, our meeting next Friday will center around this topic. I will design materials and practice activities to correct this shortcoming. But I would also appreciate it if you could come up with some creative ways to improve our referral rate. Send me your suggestions and I will be sure to include them in our discussion. I look forward to hearing from you all.
Janice Wells,
Senior Customer Service Coordinator
Where does Ms. Wells probably work?

answer.explanation: In the article, there are many vocabulary related to delivery, shipping, parcel, packaging,...

question.text: What information did Ms. Wells review?

answer.explanation: In the article mentioned the "customer" and "satisfaction". There are also "gather opinions about our customer service"

question.text: What problem does Ms. Wells mention?
choices: (A)Few customers recommend the company to others.

answer.text: (A)Few customers recommend the company to others.
answer.explanation: Both paragraph two have internal capacitance on the issue of introducing clients to others.

question.text: What are staff asked to do?
choices: (C)Propose an alternate day for a meeting

answer.explanation: The third paragraph has the "send me. " your suggestion " and                           "discussion"

question.text:
Olsenburg Business Association
110 Cornel! Rd
Olsenburg City, Wl 530030

January 17

Mr. Kenneth Damian
Oisenburg City Mayor
City Hall
Oisenburg City, Wl 23090

Dear Mr. Mayor:

Iam writing on behalf of the Olsenburg Business Association to urge you to support legislation modifying the ban on overnight parking of large vehicles in our area. The number of tourists who travel in campers, motor homes, and other recreational vehicles (RVs) has increased significantly nationwide. While the proportion of visitors who arrive by RV is still small compared to more traditional tourists, I am sure you will agree that forcing RV tourists to leave every evening only compromises our efforts to promote tourism, which is connected to a substantial amount of income for our city. We are confident that making Olsenburg “RV friendly” will benefit the local tourism industry and its employees. Three nearby cities that have lifted similar bans have reported positive results. Tocasta Town, Gamma Village, and Arcoda City are evidence that welcoming RV tourists can promote tourism, generating more reverse for restaurants and local shops. Next month, Arcoda City will even begin adding special RV parking areas in its parks.

As you know, the tourism and food service industries employ over 25 percent of our workforce. Currently, however, many of our visitors are here only during the daytime, so we are losing business to neighboring cities. RV tourism would not compete with hotel tourism. In fact, it would only increase the total number of visitors to our city.

I look forward to seeing you at the meeting next Thursday, where the city council will address this important issue.

Respectfully yours,
Linda Defrey
Senior Vice President of overnmental Affairs
Olsenburg Business Association
What is the purpose of the letter?
choices: (C)To recommend a change in the city law

answer.text: (C)To recommend a change in the city law
answer.explanation: Information can be inferred from: "I am writing on behalf of the Olsenburg Business Association to urge you to support legislation modifying the ban on overnight parking of large vehicles in our area."

question.text: The word “compromises” in paragraph line 7, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: What is indicated about tourism in Olsenburg City?
choices: (A)The number of tourists decreased last year.
(D)Local restaurants rely on business from tourists.

answer.text: (D)Local restaurants rely on business from tourists.
answer.explanation: Information can be inferred from: "Currently, however, many of our visitors are here only during the daytime, so we are losing business to neighboring cities."

question.text: What will be discussed during next week’s meeting?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Iam writing on behalf of the Olsenburg Business Association to urge you to support legislation modifying the ban on overnight parking of large vehicles in our area."

question.text:
Respite for Commuters

A new ride-sharing app in gaining in popularity as bus and taxi fees continue to rise and commuters continue to look for more efficient routers. Jordan Mills, a small business owner who commutes into downtown from his home in Brentwood has to transfer buses twice, then, take the subway to get to his workplace. Not only did he find the commute quite costly and uncomfortable in the rush-hour crowds, he found it time- consuming. But with the availability of the new app Freewheel, he found that he saved time and money with a quick ride available within 5 minutes of flagging for a ride from any location he was at. “This is definitely the future of transportation,” said Jordan. “I can’t get to work and back any other way now”.
Jordan Mills isn't the only commuter who feels this way. An estimated 2000 new commuters in the city of Sherwood alone are expected to use the ride-sharing app within the next year and almost 500 new drivers have signed up to the program.
Freewheel is available for download at the Freewheel website and at Miniapp.com and Amacom.com.

===========================

www.freewheel.com/history


The idea for Freewheel began when Michael Owens and his co-workers first started a carpooling program at the company they worked at. Owens had to transfer the subway three times and the bus twice to get to work and although he could drive, the parking was limited. Fie managed the group by assigning different drivers and mapped out routes to each co-worker’s homes. Fie created an app that everyone could connect and communicate through so that the designated drivers and passengers could easily find each other. Five years later, Freewheel is now a major company with tens of thousands of users, both drivers and commuters around the country.
Freewheel is dedicated to keeping the cost of commuting down and the efficiency up. In time, it hopes to bring its services to people around the world.

===============================

Technology Initiatives

is proud to present the

New Innovation Award to:

Michael Owens, CEO of Freewheel


This award recognizes the innovation and creativity of new talent in the technology industry. It also acknowledges the effort to help consumers through the use of technology with a novel idea that has transformed the transportation community.

Susan Vaneer

Exexutive Mananager, Technology Initiatives
The word “respite” in the title of the article is closest in meaning to
What is indicated about Freewheel?
choices: (D) It is good for the environment.

question.text: How are Jordan Mills and Michael Owens similar?
choices: (B) Both wanted an efficient way to commute.
(C) Both were employed in public transportation.
(D) Both won awards for their achievements.

answer.text: (B) Both wanted an efficient way to commute.

question.text: What is the certificate awarding?
What is most likely true about Michael Owens?
choices: (C) He wants to expand his business.

answer.text: (C) He wants to expand his business.

question.text:
To:Lillian Ross -lillianross@kingstonsportinggoods.com
From:Eric West -ericwest@jmsolutions.com
Date:November 4, 10:34 A.M.
Subject:Website Development
Attachment: Details

Dear Ms. Ross,
You contacted US last week in order to ask some of our computer programmers to help your company develop a website. JM Solutions would be happy to offer you our services.
As I said on the phone, we will help design and program a website that will attract more customers and offer an online sales platform. During this time, we will need to hold meetings with your marketing division in order to best capture your company’s goals. Once the website has been completed in mid-February next year, we will hold a training seminar in order to train your employees in the skills necessary to maintain and update your website. The website development and training seminar will cost a total of $32,000. We request that a deposit of 10% be paid in advance. Please see the attached file for detailed costs and schedules.
We look forward to working with you in the near future. Our staff members will strive to meet all your needs.. Therefore, just let me know when your marketing division is available to meet US in person and discuss some of the details of the project. Please contact me at your convenience.
Eric West

===========================

To:Lillian Ross -lillianross@kingstonsportinggoods.com
From:Raymond Wells -raymondwells@kingstonsportinggoods.com
Date:November 4, 10:37 A.M.
Subject:First Quarter Budget
Attachment: Q1_Budget

Dear Ms. Ross,
I have attached the current draft for the company’s budget for the first quarter of next year. As you will notice, all of the profits made from this year’s back-to-school sale are planned to be spent on billboard advertisements on the main highways. I will call a design team later this afternoon and ask them to create eye-catching images for the advertisement.
At our last meeting, you mentioned that you would like to review the budget before it is finalized. I have already included employee raises in the first quarter’s expenses, but if you can think of anything else, please let me know. I would like to have the budget finalized before next week’s planning meeting.
Raymond Wells

===========================

To:Raymond Wells -raymondwells@kingstonsportinggoods.com
From:Lillian Ross -lillianross@kingstonsportinggoods.com
Date:November 4, 10:40 AM
Subject:Emergency Budget Addition

Dear Mr. Wells,
I am glad you forwarded me your proposed budget when you did. Just prior to receiving your e-mail, I received an estimate for our planned website development. It looks like it is going to be more expensive than I had anticipated. Although the final bill of $32,000 is not due immediately, we will have to find an extra $3,200 in next year’s first quarter budget if we want to proceed with JM Solutions’ proposal.
If you have any questions regarding this matter, please just come to my office and we can go over where we can make the tough cuts to come up with this funding.
Why did Mr. West write the first e-mail?

answer.explanation:
The first part of the email: “JM Solutions would be happy to offer you our services .” 

The end of the email: “Therefore, just let me know when your marketing division is available to meet us in person and discuss some of the details of the project”

question.text: What service does JM Solutions provide?

answer.explanation: The first part of the email: ”.... we will help design and program a website ....”

question.text: According to the second e-mail, how will the profits of the back-to-school sale be spent?
choices: (C) On paying for JM Solutions’ service

answer.explanation:
Keyword "profit", "back-to- school sale"

The sentence contains keywords: “As you will notice, all of the profits made from this year's back-to-school sale are planned to be spent on billboard advertisement on the main highways.”

question.text: What is indicated by the third e-mail?
choices: (A) The budget for the first quarter of next year looks good.
(B) JM Solutions has a strong reputation.
(C) It will be easy for Kingston Sporting Goods to find money in their budget for web development.
(D) Some items in the budget may lose their funding in order to pay for web development.

answer.text: (D) Some items in the budget may lose their funding in order to pay for web development.
answer.explanation:
The inferred question, based on information “I received an estimate for our planned website development             

Although the final bill of $ 32,000 is not due immediately, we will have to find an extra $ 3,800 in next year's first quarter if we want to proceed with JM Solutions' proposal. ”

question.text: Why does Kingston Sporting Goods need to allow for $3,200 for web development?
choices: (A) They need the best web money can buy.
(B) They have to expand their business into other territories.
(C) They have to pay JM Solutions 10% of the overall cost as a deposit.
(D) They have to negotiate a better price after the deposit.

answer.text: (C) They have to pay JM Solutions 10% of the overall cost as a deposit.
answer.explanation: In the first email when JM Solutions introduced their service: “The website development and training seminar will cost a total of $ 32,000. We request that a deposit of 10% be paid in advance.

question.text:
Film Festival Returns to Wales
SWANSEA (24 May)—The Penglais Film Festival returns to town with a full slate of exciting new films. The festival has gained international recognition for the talent it has attracted over the years. It also boasts of having launched the careers of a growing number of celebrity filmmakers.
The week-long festival will run from 9 to 15 August and will feature animated, documentary, and feature films. The festival is open to the public, with the exception of the closing event on 15 August, which is by invitation only. Tickets for all public events must be purchased in advance and are expected to sell out quickly.
Ticket sales will begin at 10 a.m. on 3 June. Please note that tickets for individual film showings must be purchased separately. A full schedule of screenings is now available on the festival’s Web site at www.penglaisfest.co.uk.
===============================
Email
To: Desmond Griffith
From: Ioan Driscoll
Subject: Re: Penglais Award Ceremony
Date: 28 May
Dear Mr. Griffith,
I am excited and honoured to hear that you will be able to accept your prize in person at this year’s Penglais Award Ceremony. The ceremony will take place at the Wynford Blue Hotel at 5 P.M. on Friday, 15 August. You will be introduced by the festival’s president, Ms. Sarah Wu, and you will have the opportunity to give a speech. We kindly request that you limit this speech to no more than 10 minutes.
Please provide me with the e-mail addresses of up to five guests you would like to invite to the ceremony. I will be sure to send them each a link to download their ticket electronically within ten days of the event.
Congratulations,
loan Driscoll

===============================

 
The 25th Annual Penglais Film Festival Awards Ceremony Event Program
  
5:00 P.M.   Doors open
5:30 P.M.   Dinner service begins
6:00 P.M.   Performance by Shirley Finch, accompanied by Dorn Lucas on piano
6:15 P.M.   Presentation Of Excellence in Acting awards
6:30 P.M.   Presentation Of Achievement in Direction awards
6:45 P.M.   Presentation of Best Cinematography award
7:00 P.M.   Introduction of Lifetime Achievement Award by Ms. Sarah Wu  
7:10 P.M.   Speech by Lifetime Achievement Award Recipient
7:20 P.M.   Closing remarks
7:30 P.M.   Final performance by Shirley Finch, solo
What is indicated about the Pengglais Film Festival?
choices: (C)It  focuses on classic films from the past.
(D)Tickets to feature films have sold out.

answer.explanation: The last sentence of paragraph 1: It also boasts of having launched the careers of a growing number of celebrity filmmakers.

question.text: Why is Mr. Driscoll pleased?
choices: (B)His film will be shown at the festival.
(D)Mr. Griffith has invited him to speak.

answer.explanation: Email: I am excited and honored to hear that you will be able to accept your prize in person at this year's Penglais Award Ceremony.

question.text: What is suggested about tickets for the awards ceremony?
choices: (D)They are included with the purchase of individual film tickets.

answer.explanation: The article only mentions buying movie tickets, not buying tickets for the awards ceremony.

question.text: Who most likely is Shirley Finch?

answer.explanation:
In the invitation card program:
- Performance by Shirley Finch , accompanied by Dom Lucas on piano
- Final performance by Shirley Finch, solo

question.text: What award will Mr. Griffith most likely receive?

answer.explanation:
In the mail: You will be introduced by the festival's president, Ms. Sarah Wu, and you will have the opportunity to give a speech .
In the program: Speech by Lifetime Achievement Award Recipient

question.text:
Order #: 23740

Maple Outdoor

387 Maple Street, York WA

Date: May 6

ITEM BRAND UNIT PRICE
Hiking Boots Nordic Heights $149.95 $149.59
Camping Stove Avalanche $58.79 $58.79
Fuel Canister Avalanche $9.98 $19.96
Socks Northern Wool $12.85 $0.00 (Comp.)
    Total: $228.34  
* We've included a free pair of socks to keep you warm on your next camping trip.
Thank you for being a loyal patron of Maple Outdoor for more than a year!
As always, if there is anything we can assist you with, don't hesitate to ask. Remember, if your are contacting US about a specific order, make sure to give us the order number and your name.
Call us: (601) 478-2129
E-mail us: MapleOutdoor@zmail.com

===========================

To: Customer Service, Maple Outdoor
From: Shana Sandberg
Date: Oct. 9
Subject: Delivery Issues

I received my order yesterday and it wasn’t what I had expected. I had ordered an Avalanche camping stove, but I received a MT Elite stove instead. I'd like to receive the Avalanche stove as soon as possible, as I’ve got a fall camping trip next weekend. Do you think you could get it to me in time, or should I just come and exchange the stove at your store? Please contact me soon. I’ll be waiting.
Thank you,
Shanna Sandberg
What requested information did Ms. Sandberg forget to include?

answer.explanation:
The bottom of the bill says “Remember, if you are contacting us about a specific order, make sure to give us the order number and your name. ”
When Ms. Sandberg sent the mail, it included her name. So the missing information is the number of orders.

question.text: How much does an Avalanche fuel canister cost?

answer.explanation: Look in the invoice, the unit price column for this item.

question.text: What does Maple Outdoor mention about Ms. Sandberg’s order?
choices: (A) It will be delayed for up to a month.
(B) They have expedited it for free.
(C) It may not be returned if it is damaged by misuse.
(D) They have included a complimentary item with it.

answer.text: (D) They have included a complimentary item with it.
answer.explanation: This is mentioned at the end of the bill, which is a free pair of socks.

question.text: What is true about Ms. Sandberg?
choices: (A) She has shopped at Maple Outdoor before.
(C) She didn’t receive her hiking boots.
(D) She will be visiting the Maple Outdoor store soon.

answer.text: (A) She has shopped at Maple Outdoor before.
answer.explanation: Can be inferred from Sentence on invoice: "Thank you for being a loyal patron of Maple Outdoor for more than a year!"

question.text: Why did Ms. Sandberg write the e-mail?
choices: (A) To compliment the service she received
(C) To ask if she can return an item
(D) To complain of a missing item

answer.text: (D) To complain of a missing item
answer.explanation: Conceivably, this email is for complaints. “I had ordered an Avalanche camping stove, but l received a MT Elite stove instead.” (I ordered an Avalanche camping stove, but I got an MT Elite stove instead.) So the item that's missing is the Avalanche camping stove.
